medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe undermasculinization and poor response to exogenous androgens.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented with perineal hypospadias and micropenis at birth. Several surgical procedures were performed between the ages of 3 and 12 years to correct the hypospadias. At 15 years, the patient developed bilateral gynecomastia, with testes having 6 ml in volume bilaterally. There was no further virilization noted as testis volumes increased to 10 ml by 20 years of age.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient had undergone multiple surgeries for hypospadias and exhibited bilateral gynecomastia. There were no significant responses to testosterone injections or topical DHT gel.
medical_history.family_history: The patient was the firstborn of nonconsanguineous parents and had two normal female siblings. No family history of genital ambiguity or infertility in maternal uncles was reported.
